topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Attaching and Detaching Volume Instances

body.p: After you've created one or more volumes, you can attach them to instances, one instance at a time.
You can view the status of a volume in the Volumes tab of the dashboard. The volume is either Available or In-Use. You can attach any volume that is available to an instance.

section.title: Attach a volume to an instance

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Volumes link.
In the Volumes screen, for the volume you want to attach, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Edit Attchments.
In the Manage Volume Attachments dialog box, select an instance.
Enter the name of the device from which the volume is accessible by the instance. (Note: The actual device name might differ from the volume name because of hypervisor settings.)

section.p: The dashboard shows the volume is In-Use and lists the instance to which the volume is now attached. You can now log in to the instance and mount, format, and use the disk.
Note: Not all of the Action menu items are available for an attached volume.

section.title: Detach a volume from a VM instance

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Volumes link.
In the Volumes screen, for the volume you want to detach, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Edit Attchments.
Click Detach Volume to confirm your changes.

section.p: The dashboard shows the volume is available.
